summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 discussing technical issues with the recording system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) where Jeffrey Epstein was held. The FBI is retrieving previous recordings, which will disable recording capabilities for 8-10 days, prompting inquiries about backup options.

events.title: FBI Retrieves MCC Camera Recordings
events.description: The FBI is retrieving previous recordings from the camera system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), disabling recording capabilities for 8-10 days during the process.

keyFacts: The FBI was retrieving recordings from the camera system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in August 2019.
The recording retrieval process was expected to take 8-10 days, during which recording capabilities would be offline.
Live viewing/monitoring of the camera system remained functional during this period.
The email chain discusses technical concerns and options for emergency replacement or remote recording capabilities.
The correspondence occurs shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in MCC custody on August 10, 2019.
